newsitem.title: ITALY: Estonia has heart set on EU, not NATO - minister.
newsitem.headline: Estonia has heart set on EU, not NATO - minister.

text.p: Estonia wants to join NATO, but its main ambition is to become a member of the European Union, Estonian Foreign Minister Toomas Ilves said on Thursday during a visit to Italy.
The small Baltic state has applied to join both the 15-bloc EU and the 16-nation North Atlantic Treaty Organisation (NATO).

"Estonia's priority is not to join NATO but rather the European Union," Ilves told a convention. "Our aspirations are legitimate given the progress the country has made consolidating its market economy and democratic institutions," he added.
Both NATO and the EU are due to decide later this year on the possible incorporation of a number of eastern European countries.
NATO expansion is the main focus of the U.S.-Russian summit currently being held in Helsinki.
Moscow is believed to be particularly sensitive about the position of the Baltics -- the Soviet Union's western flank during the Cold War and home to large Russian minorities.
